page.title: 17FARM SURVEYS AT NANTGLYN 2
page.content: Other farming studied followed a similar pattern,except that the farms were run by Welsh families. One of the largest was 104h. with up to 900 sheep Dominant land use was improved pasture with hay grown on 1/3 to 1/5 of the land. Average density was 8 sheep per hectare. None of the farms employed labour except for shearing which was a combination of family,friends and contractors! All the farms had tractors,hay makers,fertiliser spinners,and mowers.Beef cattle were a common addition, Welsh black and Hereford cross being common breeds. Most felt that the future for farming was good but complained that grants had gone down.
